newsitem.title: CANADA: Bank of Canada sets specials at 3.5 percent.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Canada sets specials at 3.5 percent.

text.p: The Bank of Canada set two rounds of special purchase and resale agreements in the money market on Wednesday, traders said.
The central bank intervened on the money market after the call loan or overnight lending rate traded at the top of the banks' recently raised 3.0-3.5 percent target range for the rate.
Analysts said the move was meant to relieve pressure on the call loan target band and had been expected.
The Government of Canada's three-month cash T-bill traded with a yield of 3.21 percent after the second intervention.
